answers.author: Sam Anselm
answers.text:
I don't know if the city I worked for still has the system in place, but we asked departments every year to survey their customers in a least two areas (they could pick which two topics to track) and asked for their satisfaction levels/input. We then reported those results every year to our elected officials. I also like what Ken Miller has written about the topic in "Extreme Government Makeover" and "We Don't Make Widgets". Those books may be worth a read.

Here are two strategic plans that both heavily focus on customer service improvements. While these plans have other parts I believe you may find something useful in them to help you either create your own model or find the best fitting one for your organization.

author: Kevin Carter
text:
We're looking at developing a Strategic Plan to improve customer service at our federal agency (Office of Personnel Management) and would like to know if any local governments have models that they could recommend.
Thanks.
title: Customer Service Strategic Plans?
